response: Oh, he's guilty for sure. It's just obvious! The guy's lawyers couldn't give a single bit of proof for why he's innocent!
This man deserves to rot for what he did to that poor lady!

Oh, Katie's great! We go out to dinner at least once a month. She's actually the reason I found out about this whole thing. She said I would make the perfect juror for this big case she was working on!
She said she needs a really smart person to crack this case.
They say it's not about what you know, it's who you know.
I'm sorry, what was the question again?
There's more to life than a little bit of money. Didn't he know that?
The owner of that pawn shop says he sold a gun exactly like the one the defendant used only two days earlier. But his identification was very vague.
In his initial report to the police, he described a tall, brown-haired man with blue eyes. That doesn't seem to match the defendant at all.
He ID'ed him later in court though, so maybe I'm just crazy.

text: Alright everyone. Should we get started?
That's actually something I wanted to bring up. I think the pawn shop owner's report to the police was a bit vague and innaccurate.
